name: abnormal eyelashes
description: Eyelashes of unusual growth, arrangement, or structure.

name: abnormal eyelid
description: Malformation or unusual appearance of the eyelid.

name: abnormal iris
description: Iris with an unusual structure, color, or function.

name: abnormal lacrimal system
description: Disorder or defect in the lacrimal glands or ducts.

name: abnormal laryngeal cartilage
description: Cartilage of the larynx with unusual morphology or calcification.

name: absent cervical lymphoid tissue
description: Lack of lymphoid tissue in the cervical region.

name: absent nose
description: Complete absence of the nasal structure.

name: absent paranasal sinus
description: One or more paranasal sinuses are absent.

name: acquired craniovertebral junction abnormality
description: Abnormality at the junction between the cranium and the cervical spine acquired after birth.

name: acquired skull defect
description: Defect in the skull resulting from injury or surgical intervention.

name: advanced mastoid pneumatization
description: Excessive air cell development in the mastoid bone.

name: ankyloblepharon
description: Fusion of the eyelids preventing normal opening.

name: anodontia or hypodontia
description: Absence of teeth (anodontia) or fewer teeth than normal (hypodontia).

name: anophthalmia
description: Absence of one or both eyes.

name: antegonial notching of the mandible
description: Indentation near the anterior angle of the mandible.

name: base of tongue mass
description: Abnormal mass located at the base of the tongue.

name: bifid nose
description: Nose split into two sections often due to developmental anomaly.

name: bilateral cheek masses
description: Masses present in the cheek area on both sides.

name: bilateral enlargement of the mandible in a child
description: Enlargement of the mandible on both sides observed in children.

name: bilaterally enlarged and heterogeneous parotids
description: Both parotid glands are enlarged and have inconsistent texture.

name: blepharophimosis
description: Narrowing of the horizontal aperture of the eyelid.

name: blue sclerae
description: A bluish tinge to the sclera of the eyes, often associated with connective tissue disorders.

name: bulbous nose
description: A prominently rounded nasal tip or structure.

name: calvarial hyperostosis
description: Thickening of the skull bones.

name: carotid space mass
description: A mass localized within the carotid space in the neck.

name: cervical kyphosis
description: Abnormal forward curvature of the cervical spine.

name: cherubic facies
description: Facial appearance characterized by full cheeks and a round face, often related to genetic disorders.

name: choanal atresia
description: Congenital obstruction of the posterior nasal cavity either unilaterally or bilaterally.

name: choanal stenosis
description: Narrowing of the choanae, leading to airflow obstruction.

name: cholesteatoma
description: An abnormal growth of squamous epithelium in the middle ear and/or mastoid process.

name: cleft lip/palate
description: A congenital split in the upper lip and/or roof of the mouth.

name: cloverleaf skull deformity
description: A trilobular skull shape due to premature fusion of skull bones, often associated with syndromic craniosynostosis.

name: coloboma
description: A defect in the eye structure, usually present from birth.

name: congenital hypodontia
description: Congenital absence of one or more teeth.

name: congenital midface hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the midfacial skeleton present at birth.

name: congenital pharyngeal abnormality
description: Anomalies in the structure of the pharynx present from birth.

name: congenital prognathism
description: Forward positioning of the jaw present from birth.

name: congenital skull defect
description: An absence or defect in part of the skull detectable at birth.

name: conjunctivitis
description: Inflammation of the conjunctiva, usually caused by infection or allergy.

name: craniotubular dysplasia
description: Disorder characterized by thickened cranial and tubular bones.

name: cryptophthalmos
description: Complete or partial fusion of the eyelids

name: cyst-like mandibular lesion
description: A lesion in the mandible with cystic appearance

name: cystic floor-of-mouth mass
description: Mass in the floor of the mouth with cystic characteristics

name: cystic jaw lesion
description: Cystic lesion located in the jaw

name: cystic lesion in maxilla
description: Cystic lesion located in the maxilla

name: cystic nasopharyngeal mass
description: Mass in the nasopharyngeal region with cystic appearance

name: cystic salivary gland mass
description: Mass in the salivary gland with cystic characteristics

name: deafness
description: Complete or partial inability to hear

name: defective dentition
description: Abnormal condition of the teeth

name: delayed dentition
description: Delayed eruption of teeth in children

name: delayed tooth eruption
description: Delay in the normal process of tooth eruption

name: dental cyst
description: Cystic lesion in or around a tooth

name: dental defect
description: Structural anomalies or deformities in teeth

name: dental periapical opacity
description: Increased radiodensity around the apex of a tooth

name: depressed nasal bridge
description: Lower than normal positioning of the nasal bridge

name: destructive lesion in petrous apex
description: Aggressive lesion causing bone destruction in the petrous apex

name: destructive nasopharyngeal mass in a child
description: A mass in the nasopharynx causing destruction, typically in children

name: diffuse lipomatosis of the neck
description: Abnormal, diffuse fatty infiltration of the neck tissue

name: ear cartilage calcification
description: Calcium deposition in ear cartilage

name: early loss of teeth
description: Premature loss of teeth beyond the expected age

name: enlarged epiglottis
description: Swelling or increased size of the epiglottis

name: enlarged orbital rectus muscles
description: Increase in size of the muscles surrounding the eyeball

name: enlarged superior ophthalmic vein
description: Dilation of the superior ophthalmic vein

name: enlarged superior orbital fissure
description: Widened space between bones at the superior aspect of the orbit

name: erosion of mastoid
description: Destruction of mastoid air cells or bony processes

name: erosion of middle ear
description: Destruction of structures in the middle ear due to pathological processes

name: erosion of tympanic portion of petrous bone
description: Destruction in the tympanic region of the petrous temporal bone

name: exophthalmos
description: Protrusion of the eyeball from the orbit

name: external auditory canal stenosis
description: Narrowing of the ear canal passage

name: external auditory canal tumor
description: Neoplastic growth within the ear canal

name: external ear calcification
description: Calcium deposits within the tissues of the external ear

name: external ear malformation
description: Congenital abnormality of the external ear structure

name: extraconal orbital lesion
description: Abnormality or mass located outside the cone of extraocular muscles

name: extraglobal calcification
description: Calcium deposits outside the globe of the eye

name: extraocular muscle enlargement
description: Increase in size of the muscles controlling eyeball movement

name: extraorbital extracranial lesion extending to the orbit
description: Lesion located outside the orbit extending into orbital space

name: extrinsic impression on the cervical esophagus
description: Indentation on the esophagus caused by external pressure

name: eyeball deformity
description: Structural abnormality of the eyeball

name: eyebrow anomaly
description: Unusual eyebrow structure or anomalous presentation

name: eyelid ptosis
description: Drooping of the upper eyelid

name: facial asymmetry
description: Uneven appearance or size of facial features.

name: facial canal lesion within temporal bone
description: Abnormality in the bony canal containing the facial nerve.
synonyms: temporal bone lesion with facial nerve involvement

name: facial cleft
description: Congenital anomaly involving a gap or split in facial tissues.

name: facial hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of facial bones or tissues.

name: facial nerve lesion outside the temporal bone
description: Lesion affecting the facial nerve outside of the temporal bone.

name: facial nerve palsy
description: Weakness or paralysis of muscles innervated by the facial nerve.

name: fatty parapharyngeal space lesion
description: Fat-containing mass in the parapharyngeal space.

name: fatty tumor of the neck
description: Lipoma occurring within neck tissues.

name: fetal cranial deformity
description: Abnormal shape in fetal skull, detectable via imaging.

name: fetal neck mass
description: Mass located in fetal neck region.

name: floating teeth
description: Appearance of teeth on radiographic images where roots appear not anchored.

name: fluid level in a paranasal sinus
description: Presence of fluid detected in sinus cavity on imaging.

name: fluid-filled sinus mass
description: Mass containing fluid located within a sinus.

name: functional pharyngeal disorder
description: Disorders affecting the movement and function of the pharynx.

name: generalized osteopenia or osteolysis of the jaws
description: Decreased bone density observed in jaw bones.

name: glaucoma
description: Eye condition characterized by increased intraocular pressure.

name: globe calcification
description: Calcium deposits within the globe of the eye.

name: globe lesion
description: Abnormality or mass within the eye globe.

name: goiter
description: Enlargement of the thyroid gland.

name: hair-on-end skull
description: Radiographic appearance resembling bristles due to expanded marrow spaces.

name: hyperdontia
description: An excess of teeth beyond the normal number.

name: hypertelorism
description: Increased distance between the eyes.

name: hypoplastic cervical lymphoid tissue
description: Underdeveloped lymphoid tissue in the cervical region.

name: hypoplastic paranasal sinus
description: Underdevelopment of the paranasal sinuses.

name: hypotelorism
description: Decreased distance between the eyes.

name: ill-defined enlarged thyroid with extrathyroid extension
description: Thyroid gland enlargement with unclear borders extending beyond thyroid.

name: ill-defined expansile radiolucent jaw lesion
description: Growth within the jaw causing a clear area on X-ray with unclear margin.

name: ill-defined lytic jaw lesion
description: Destructive bone lesion in the jaw with unclear boundaries.

name: increased nuchal fold
description: Thickened area at the back of the fetal neck.

name: increased pneumatization of mastoids
description: Greater than normal air cell development in mastoid bones.

name: increased prevertebral space in an adult
description: Widening of the space in front of the vertebrae in adults.

name: increased prevertebral space in infants or children
description: Widening of the space in front of the vertebrae in infants or children.

name: infratemporal fossa lesion
description: Abnormal growth or mass within the infratemporal fossa region.

name: inner ear anomaly
description: Abnormality in the structure of the inner ear.

name: internal jugular vein thrombosis
description: Blood clot in the internal jugular vein.

name: interradicular radiolucency in the jaw
description: Radiolucent lesion between the roots of teeth in the jaw.

name: intracranial lesion involving the orbit
description: Lesion inside the skull affecting the eye socket.

name: intraocular mass in a child
description: Mass located within the eye of a pediatric patient.

name: intraorbital calcification
description: Calcified material within the orbit.

name: lacrimal gland enlargement
description: Increase in size of the lacrimal gland.

name: large fontanelle
description: An abnormally large soft spot on a baby's skull.

name: large foramen magnum
description: An unusually large opening in the skull where the spinal cord passes.

name: large head in infant
description: Infant head size significantly larger than normal.

name: large orbit
description: Enlargement of the bony eye socket.

name: large sella turcica
description: Increased size of the sella turcica, the bony cavity in the skull.

name: large tongue
description: Abnormal enlargement of the tongue.

name: laryngeal asymmetry
description: Unequal size or shape of the larynx on one side compared to the other.

name: laryngeal tumor
description: A mass or growth located in the larynx.

name: lateral extraconal lesion
description: Lesion located outside the eye's cone-shaped muscle arrangement.

name: lens dislocation
description: Displacement of the eye's lens from its normal position.

name: lens opacity
description: Cloudiness in the lens leading to vision obstruction.

name: lesion of hard palate
description: An abnormal area on the hard palate of the mouth.

name: lesion of soft palate
description: An abnormal area on the soft palate of the mouth.

name: lesions of the hypopharynx, larynx, and upper trachea
description: Abnormal areas or masses in the hypopharynx, larynx, or upper trachea.

name: lip defect
description: Anomaly or imperfection in the lip structure.

name: localized bony defect about the optic canal
description: A specific bone abnormality near the optic canal.

name: localized bulge of the calvarium or scalp
description: A distinct protrusion of the skull or scalp area.

name: loss of lamina dura of teeth
description: Absence of the lamina dura around the teeth root seen on X-rays.

name: low hairline
description: A hairline that is further down than average on the forehead.

name: low-set ears
description: Ears positioned lower than the typical alignment with eyes and nose.

name: lytic jaw lesion with internal residual bone
description: Lesion in the jaw characterized by bone destruction with some bone remaining.

name: macrocephaly
description: Condition where the head is abnormally large, often indicating underlying abnormalities.

name: macroglossia
description: Abnormal enlargement of the tongue.

name: malformed orbit
description: Abnormal development or structure of the orbit.

name: mandibular agenesis/dysgenesis
description: Absence or abnormal development of the mandible.

name: mandibular periostitis
description: Inflammatory condition affecting the periosteum of the mandible.

name: masticator space lesion
description: Abnormal growth or lesion in the masticator space.

name: mastoiditis
description: Inflammation of the mastoid process.

name: metastatic cervical lymphadenopathy
description: Enlarged lymph nodes in the neck due to cancer spread.

name: microglossia
description: Abnormally small tongue.

name: micrognathia
description: Small or receding mandible.

name: microphthalmia
description: Abnormally small eyes.

name: microspherophakia
description: Small, spherical lenses in the eyes.

name: microstomia
description: Abnormally small mouth.

name: middle ear anomaly
description: Abnormal structure or formation of the middle ear.

name: mixed-radiopacity jaw lesion
description: Jaw lesion with varying degrees of radiopacity.

name: multilocular jaw lesion
description: Jaw lesion with multiple loculated compartments.

name: multiple discrete intraparotid lesions
description: Multiple distinct lesions within the parotid gland.

name: multiple opaque jaw lesions
description: Multiple jaw lesions appearing opaque on imaging.

name: multiple well-defined radiolucent jaw lesions
description: Multiple jaw lesions appearing radiolucent and well-defined on imaging.

name: myopia
description: A refractive error where close objects appear clear but distant ones are blurry.

name: narrowed superior orbital fissure
description: A condition involving the narrowing of the superior orbital fissure.

name: nasal cavity lesion
description: An abnormal mass or defect located in the nasal cavity.

name: nasal polyposis
description: The presence of polyps in the nasal cavity, often related to chronic inflammation.

name: nasal ridge mass in a child
description: An abnormal mass located on the nasal ridge, found in children.

name: nasal septum perforation
description: A defect or hole in the nasal septum.

name: nasopharyngeal extension of intracranial neoplasm
description: Intracranial tumor extending into the nasopharynx.

name: nasopharyngeal lesion
description: An abnormal mass or lesion in the nasopharynx.

name: natal teeth
description: Teeth present at birth or erupting during the first month of life.

name: neck mass
description: A growth or lump in the neck region.

name: nonodontogenic radiolucent jaw lesion
description: A radiolucent lesion in the jaw not arising from tooth origin.

name: nuchal cystic hygroma
description: A cystic lymphatic malformation in the neck region, often noted in fetuses.

name: nystagmus
description: Involuntary eye movement, possibly indicating underlying neurological issues.

name: optic atrophy
description: Degeneration of the optic nerve leading to vision loss.

name: optic canal enlargement
description: The widening of the optic canal, possibly indicating tumors or other pathologies.

name: optic nerve enlargement
description: Enlargement of the optic nerve, which can indicate pathology such as glioma.

name: optic nerve tram-track sign
description: Imaging appearance of optic nerve sheath meningioma, showing calcified or thickened dural sheath.

name: orbital bony defect
description: A defect or gap in the bony structures of the orbit.

name: orbital mass
description: A mass located within the orbit.

name: orbital wall lesion
description: An abnormal lesion affecting the wall of the orbit.

name: orbital wall sclerosis
description: Hardening of the orbital wall structures.

name: oropharyngeal lesion
description: Abnormal tissue observed in the oropharynx.

name: osseous paranasal sinus lesion
description: Bone-related abnormality in the paranasal sinuses.

name: otosclerosis
description: Abnormal bone growth in the ear, leading to hearing loss.

name: paralaryngeal cystic mass
description: Cystic growth around the larynx area.

name: paranasal sinus mass
description: Abnormal growth within the paranasal sinuses.

name: paranasal sinus opacification
description: Clouding of the sinus cavities often due to fluid or inflammation.

name: parapharyngeal space lesion
description: Abnormality or growth in the parapharyngeal space.

name: periapical mixed-radiopacity jaw lesion
description: Jaw lesion with mixed areas of radio-opacity near the tooth apex.

name: periapical radiolucency in jaw
description: Area of increased radiolucency near the apex of a tooth root.

name: periauricular pits
description: Small, often congenital indentations near the ear.

name: periauricular tag
description: Small skin projection near the ear, usually congenital.

name: pericoronal mixed-radiopacity jaw lesion
description: Lesion around a tooth crown with mixed radiographic densities.

name: pericoronal radiolucency in the jaw
description: Radiolucent area surrounding the crown of a tooth.

name: periorbital soft-tissue swelling
description: Swelling of the soft tissues around the eye.

name: pharyngeal infection
description: Infectious process affecting the pharyngeal area.

name: pharyngeal neoplasm
description: Tumor occurring in the pharyngeal region.

name: premature tooth loss
description: Loss of teeth before the typical age.

name: pterygopalatine fossa lesion
description: Abnormal growth or lesion in the pterygopalatine fossa.

name: pyriform sinus mass
description: Mass located in the pyriform sinus area of the throat.

name: retained material in hypopharynx
description: Presence of foreign or residual material in the hypopharynx.

name: retrobulbar mass
description: Mass located behind the eyeball.

name: salivary duct stricture on sialography
description: Narrowing of the salivary duct as seen on sialography imaging.

name: salivary gland abnormality
description: Any change from normal appearance or function in the salivary glands.

name: salivary gland enlargement
description: Increase in size of the salivary glands.

name: salivary gland lesion
description: Presence of an abnormal area or mass in the salivary glands.

name: salivary gland neoplasm
description: A tumor arising from the salivary glands.

name: salivary gland/duct abnormality
description: Any anomalous finding in the salivary glands or ducts.

name: sclerosis of the orbital roof
description: Hardening or abnormal density in the orbital roof on imaging.

name: single maxillary central incisor
description: Presence of only one maxillary central incisor tooth instead of two.

name: sinonasal lesion
description: Abnormal tissue or mass in the sinonasal region.

name: sinonasal mass with bony erosion
description: A mass in the sinonasal area causing destruction of bone.

name: sinonasal mass with bony remodeling without erosion
description: A mass in the sinonasal area associated with changes in bone structure without erosion.

name: sinonasal mass without bone changes
description: Sinonasal mass with no alteration to the adjacent bone.

name: sinus disease with bone destruction
description: Sinus condition leading to destruction of surrounding bone.

name: skull asymmetry
description: Uneven or unequal appearance of the skull.

name: skull base lesion
description: Abnormal area or growth at the base of the skull.

name: skull metastasis
description: Secondary malignant growth within the skull bones.

name: small foramen magnum
description: Reduced size of the foramen magnum.

name: small nose
description: Decreased size of the nose.

name: small optic canal
description: Reduced size of the bony canal through which the optic nerve passes.

name: small orbit
description: Decreased dimensions of the bony orbit.

name: small parotid gland
description: Reduced size of the parotid gland, which may indicate underlying pathology.

name: small sella turcica
description: Diminished size of the bony structure housing the pituitary gland.

name: soft tissue in the middle ear
description: Presence of soft tissue density in the tympanic cavity, possibly indicating fluid or mass.

name: soft-tissue neck mass
description: Mass of soft tissue density located in the neck region.

name: solid mass in carotid sheath
description: Solid mass located within or surrounding the carotid sheath structures.

name: solitary opacity in jaw
description: Single area of increased density within the jaw bone.

name: stomatitis
description: Inflammation of the mucous lining of the mouth.

name: strabismus
description: Misalignment of the eyes, which can be constant or intermittent.

name: subglottic tracheal narrowing
description: Reduced diameter of the trachea just below the vocal cords.

name: sublingual space lesion
description: Abnormal tissue in the sublingual space, potentially neoplastic or inflammatory.

name: submandibular space lesion
description: Pathological entity within the submandibular space.

name: superior ophthalmic vein thrombosis
description: Thrombus formation within the superior ophthalmic vein.

name: supraglottic mass
description: Mass located in the region above the vocal cords.

name: taurodontism
description: Dental condition characterized by an enlarged pulp chamber and shortened roots.

name: temporal bone osteolysis
description: Destruction of the temporal bone usually due to infection or neoplasm.

name: temporomandibular joint disease
description: Disorder affecting the jaw joint and/or surrounding muscles.

name: thick skull
description: Increased thickness of the cranial bones.

name: thyroid dysfunction
description: Abnormality in thyroid hormone production or metabolism.

name: thyroid lesion
description: Abnormal area of tissue within the thyroid gland.

name: tongue abnormality
description: Deviations from normal anatomy or function of the tongue.

name: traumatic pharyngeal disorder
description: Injury-related dysfunction or damage to the pharynx.

name: trigonocephaly
description: Premature closure of the metopic suture resulting in a triangular forehead.

name: underdeveloped mastoid
description: Poorly formed or hypoplastic mastoid air cells.

name: underdevelopment of mastoids
description: Hypoplasia of the mastoid air cells on one or both sides.

name: unilateral exophthalmos
description: Protrusion of one eye only.

name: unilateral nasal cavity mass
description: Abnormal tissue growth in one nostril.

name: unilocular cystic jaw lesion
description: Single-chambered cystic growth in the jawbone.

name: upper airway obstruction in a child
description: Blockage of the upper airways affecting breathing in children.

name: vallecular mass
description: Mass located in the vallecular space of the throat.

name: vascular middle ear mass
description: Abnormal growth in the middle ear with increased blood vessels.

name: vascular sinonasal mass with flow voids
description: Highly vascular mass in the sinonasal region displaying flow voids on MR imaging.

name: vocal cord asymmetry
description: Uneven appearance of the vocal cords.

name: vocal cord paralysis or paresis
description: Loss or reduction of vocal cord movement.

name: well-defined expansile radiolucent jaw lesion
description: Expansive radiolucent lesion in the jaw with clear borders.

name: wide sutures
description: Abnormally wide cranial sutures.

name: Wormian bones
description: Additional bone pieces within sutures of the skull.
